text: The 1926-27 Austrian football championship was organized by the Vienna Football Association and played by its members. The single-track II. League served as a substructure to the I. League. These leagues were only open to professional football clubs. SK Admira Wien became champion for the first time. The championship was decided on the last match day, when Admira won 5-0 versus Brigittenauer AC. Brigittenau was promoted the last season and finished as second. The professional section of the Wiener Amateur SV separated from the entire club and became FK Austria Wien on 28 November 1926. Other federal state associations organized state championships in different modes on an amateur basis. ==Final table== Table mode (if points are tied): Number of wins - goal quotient Pl.
